definition: deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
grieved/distressed/sad/uneasy
grieved/distressed/sad/uneasy

sentences.english: Cissokho's entourage are also in Milan and they are concerned.
sentences.chinese: 西索霍的隨行人員也一直米蘭，他們對此憂心忡忡。
謹慎小心會導致憂心忡忡。

sentences.english: It's no need to brood over inflation.
sentences.chinese: 不必對通貨膨脹問題憂心忡忡。

sentences.english: Banks also worry about unconfirmed plans to televise the conference.
sentences.chinese: 各大銀行對傳聞的會議直播計劃憂心忡忡。

sentences.english: I spent day after day in the direst suspense.
sentences.chinese: 我終日在憂心忡忡中度過。

sentences.english: He's not pathological or anything, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他曾說，掛心不等於病態的憂心忡忡。

sentences.english: Because, still have more the a Gordian knot allows investor people anxiety-ridden.
sentences.chinese: 因爲，還有更棘手的問題讓投資者們憂心忡忡。

sentences.english: She was perpetually assailed with worries.
No one enjoys someone who worries and complains about everything.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人會喜歡總是憂心忡忡並抱怨每件事的人。

sentences.english: Many worriers are gifted with imaginations.
sentences.chinese: 很多成天憂心忡忡的人天生富有想象力。

sentences.english: " said one concerned Winnetka resident, tax lawyer Ben Klein.
sentences.chinese: 稅務律師本克萊恩，一位憂心忡忡的本地居民如是說。

sentences.english: Woring never robs tomorrow of its sorrow; it only saps today of its strength.
sentences.chinese: 憂心忡忡不能解除明日的煩惱，只能消耗今日的精力。

sentences.english: He had to present a smiling face though heavy-hearted .
sentences.chinese: 雖然憂心忡忡，但他還得露出一副笑臉。

sentences.english: The mother of the sick child passed many anxious nights.
sentences.chinese: 病童的母親憂心忡忡度過了許多不眠之夜。

sentences.english: That gives security-conscious officials the shivers.
sentences.chinese: 這讓爲安全問題憂心忡忡的官員們爲之一振。

sentences.english: I was no longer upset at having been left, deceived, and used by Hanna.
sentences.chinese: 我不再因被漢娜的拋棄，欺騙和利用而憂心忡忡了。

definition: lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
panic-stricken
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
sudden and unexpected disaster (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to remain unmoved
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to oppose strongly/violently opposed to
at childbirth/in labor
to stake all on one throw
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
deep in debt
